result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeremy L Stanek was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Attempt Armed Robbery, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Defendant shall not use/possess drug paraphernalia and/or controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Alchemy.

Random UA & BA testing at discretion of agent.  Defendant shall complete a risk and needs assessment and comply with care plan goals related to prioritized need areas identified.   Defendant advised of requirement to provide DNA sample. Any other conditions DOC, Probation/Parole Department may impose.

timeConds.notes: With huber. Credit does NOT apply.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.  Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
8/27/2020 Crt amends JOC to reflect 461 days credit.

superMiscConds.notes: Defendant shall not use/possess drug paraphernalia and/or controlled substances without a valid prescription. Not to use or possess alcohol.
Defendant shall complete a risk and needs assessment and comply with care plan goals related to prioritized need areas identified.  Defendant advised of requirement to provide DNA sample-on file
